title: Erigon stops syncing once it reaches blockheight
body:
#### System information

erigon version 2022.07.1-alpha-09776394

OS & Version: Linux Ubuntu 20.04

Commit hash : 0977639431fe520fc77399d03cdeba36526d2d52

#### Expected behaviour
Erigon was started from a full backup from an existing node (2022.99.99-dev-0a527fed), the node should start syncing from where the existing node stopped before backup and then continue syncing to blockheight.

#### Actual behaviour
Erigon syncs to blockheight then stops syncing, it is aware of other blocks, but loops over the latest block endlessly in stage 1, never progressing, restart of erigon syncs to blockheight again, then same loop appears.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34198053/177550321-13c1d570-df6e-41d7-a702-d8934c6e36a6.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34198053/177550277-edc19684-8e96-4065-b1df-641cfadc4cf6.png)


#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
No idea

#### Backtrace

````

````
